title: Print, "The Vow of Jephthah", 1725–45
medium: Hand-colored etching with watercolor on paper
inscribed:
At bottom left: "Jephte"; bottom right: "Avec privilege du Roy."
Signed in reverse on a piece of armor, in the right foreground: "Scotin Sc."
Line along left edge.
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Right portion of panel. Shows Jephthah standing with his eyes uplifted and one hand stretched out, among other men in armor, on a hill, beneath a tree. Below the hill, at right, are three soldiers and a chariot drawn by two horses.

participants.person_name: Gerard Jean Baptiste Scotin, the Younger

tombstone.epitaph: Print, "The Vow of Jephthah", 1725–45.Hand-colored etching with watercolor on paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1921-22-288.
